intro: Dalechampia brevicolumna, commonly known as the short-stemmed dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family, and are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Dalechampia brevicolumna is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
